definition: sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
evening/sunset
way/route/road
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
uninspired/dejected/discouraged
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
fall (of an empire)
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
scared out of one's wits (idiom); in a panic
to decline/to wane/weakened/enfeebled/in decline
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
the country ruined and the people starving (idiom)
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
lit. chrysanthemums after the Double Ninth Festival (idiom)/fig. outdated/thing of the past/dead letter
